meanings.definition: A tool used for gripping or bending objects.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used the plier to tighten the bolt.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps a plier in her toolbox for fixing things around the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the plier to crack open a nut.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a plier, bending but never breaking.
meanings.sent5: The shiny plier gleamed in the sunlight as it clamped onto the wire.

meanings.definition: One who plies a trade or profession.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman was a skilled plier of his trade, always bringing in a good catch.
meanings.sent2: She admired the dedication of the plier who worked tirelessly in the bakery.
meanings.sent3: The young plier of stories entertained the children with his imaginative tales.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a master plier of the art of negotiation, always getting the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The plier of wood crafted beautiful furniture with precision and care.
